datatype.name: Pathway Ontology
datatype.definition: The Pathway Ontology captures information on biological networks, the relationships between netweorks and the alterations or malfunctioning of such networks within a hierarchical structure. The five main branches of the ontology are: classic metabolic pathways, regulatory, signaling, drug, and disease pathwaysfor complex human conditions.

resource.dataInfo: Pathway Ontology at Rat Genome Database
resource.dataInstitution: Medical College of Wisconsin, Wisconsin
European Bioinformatics Institute, Hinxton, Cambridge
National Center for Biomedical Ontology, Stanford, California

datatype.name: Sequence Read Archive
datatype.definition: The Sequence Read Archive (SRA) stores raw sequencing data from the next generation of sequencing platforms Data submitted to SRA. It is organized using a metadata model consisting of six objects: study, sample, experiment, run, analysis and submission. The SRA study contains high-level information including goals of the study and literature references, and may be linked to the INSDC BioProject database.

resource.dataInstitution: National Center for Biotechnology Information (NCBI), NIH, Maryland
European Bioinformatics Institute, Hinxton, Cambridge
DNA Data Bank of Japan, Shizuoka

datatype.name: ScerTF
datatype.definition: ScerTF is a database of position weight matrices (PWMs) for transcription factors in Saccharomyces species. It identifies a single matrix for each TF that best predicts in vivo data, providing metrics related to the performance of that matrix in accurately representing the DNA binding specificity of the annotated transcription factor.

resource.dataInstitution: Department of Genetics, Washington University Medical School, St Louis, Missouri

datatype.name: PharmGKB Gene
datatype.definition: The PharmGKB database is a central repository for genetic, genomic, molecular and cellular phenotype data and clinical information about people who have participated in pharmacogenomics research studies. The data includes, but is not limited to, clinical and basic pharmacokinetic and pharmacogenomic research in the cardiovascular, pulmonary, cancer, pathways, metabolic and transporter domains.

resource.dataInstitution: Department of Genetics, School of Medicine, Stanford University, Stanford, California

restriction.statement: The data may be used for research purposes only.

link.desc: terms and conditions of data use

datatype.name: miRNEST
datatype.definition: miRNEST is a database of animal, plant and virus microRNAs, containing miRNA predictions conducted on Expressed Sequence Tags of animal and plant species.

resource.dataInstitution: Institute of Molecular Biology, Adam Mickiewicz University, Poznan

datatype.name: NAPP
datatype.definition: NAPP (Nucleic Acids Phylogenetic Profiling is a clustering method based on conserved noncoding RNA (ncRNA) elements in a bacterial genomes. Short intergenic regions from a reference genome are compared with other genomes to identify RNA rich clusters.

resource.dataInstitution: Institut de Génétique et Microbiologie, UMR 8621, CNRS, Université Paris Sud, Paris

datatype.name: NONCODE v3
datatype.definition: NONCODE is a database of expression and functional lncRNA (long noncoding RNA) data obtained from microarray studies. LncRNAs have been shown to play key roles in various biological processes such as imprinting control, circuitry controlling pluripotency and differentiation, immune responses and chromosome dynamics. The collection references NONCODE version 3. This was replaced in 2013 by version 4.

resource.dataInfo: NONCODE at Chinese Academy of Sciences
resource.dataInstitution: Bioinformatics Research Group, Chinese Academy of Sciences, Beijing

datatype.name: VIRsiRNA
datatype.definition: The VIRsiRNA database contains details of siRNA/shRNA which target viral genome regions. It provides efficacy information where available, as well as the siRNA sequence, viral target and subtype, as well as the target genomic region.

resource.dataInfo: VIRsiRNA at Institute of Microbial Technology
resource.dataInstitution: Institute of Microbial Technology, Council of Scientific and Industrial Research (CSIR), Chandigarh, India

datatype.name: ELM
datatype.definition: Linear motifs are short, evolutionarily plastic components of regulatory proteins. Mainly focused on the eukaryotic sequences,the Eukaryotic Linear Motif resource (ELM) is a database of curated motif classes and instances.

resource.dataInstitution: Structural and Computational Biology, European Molecular Biology Laboratory, Heidelberg

datatype.name: MimoDB
datatype.definition: MimoDB is a database collecting peptides that have been selected from random peptide libraries based on their ability to bind small compounds, nucleic acids, proteins, cells, tissues and organs. It also stores other information such as the corresponding target, template, library, and structures.

resource.dataInfo: MimoDB at University of Electronic Science and Technology of China
resource.dataInstitution: Key Laboratory for Neuroinformation of Ministry of Education, University of Electronic Science and Technology of China, Sichuan

datatype.name: SitEx
datatype.definition: SitEx is a database containing information on eukaryotic protein functional sites. It stores the amino acid sequence positions in the functional site, in relation to the exon structure of encoding gene This can be used to detect the exons involved in shuffling in protein evolution, or to design protein-engineering experiments.

resource.dataInstitution: Novosibirsk State University, Novosibirsk

datatype.name: BYKdb
datatype.definition: The bacterial tyrosine kinase database (BYKdb) that collects sequences of putative and authentic bacterial tyrosine kinases, providing structural and functional information.

resource.dataInstitution: Unité Bases Moléculaires et Structurales des Systèmes Infectieux; CNRS - Université Claude Bernard, Lyon

datatype.name: Conoserver
datatype.definition: ConoServer is a database specialized in the sequence and structures of conopeptides, which are peptides expressed by carnivorous marine cone snails.

resource.dataInstitution: Institute for Molecular Bioscience, The University of Queensland, Brisbane

restriction.statement: Conoserver can only be used for academic research.

datatype.name: TopFind
datatype.definition: TopFIND is a database of protein termini, terminus modifications and their proteolytic processing in the species: Homo sapiens, Mus musculus, Arabidopsis thaliana, Saccharomyces cerevisiae and Escherichia coli.

resource.dataInfo: TopFind at University of British Columbia
resource.dataInstitution: Department of Oral Biological and Medical Sciences, University of British Columbia, Vancouver

datatype.name: MIPModDB
datatype.definition: MIPModDb is a database of comparative protein structure models of MIP (Major Intrinsic Protein) family of proteins, identified from complete genome sequence. It provides key information of MIPs based on their sequence and structures.

resource.dataInfo: MIPModDB at Indian Institute of Technology Kanpur
resource.dataInstitution: Department of Biological Sciences and Bioengineering, Indian Institute of Technology Kanpur, Kanpur

datatype.name: Cell Image Library

synonyms.synonym: The Cell: An Image Library-Cell Centered Database

datatype.definition: The Cell: An Image Library™ is a freely accessible, public repository of reviewed and annotated images, videos, and animations of cells from a variety of organisms, showcasing cell architecture, intracellular functionalities, and both normal and abnormal processes.

resource.dataInfo: Cell Image Library at American Society for Cell Biology
resource.dataInstitution: American Society for Cell Biology, Bethesda, Maryland and The National Center for Microscopy and Imaging Research, San Diego, California

restriction.statement: Each image may be individually associated with its own copyright restriction, which should be consulted for appropriateness by users.

datatype.name: COMBINE specifications
datatype.definition: The 'COmputational Modeling in BIology' NEtwork (COMBINE) is an initiative to coordinate the development of the various community standards and formats for computational models, initially in Systems Biology and related fields. This collection pertains to specifications of the standard formats developed by the Computational Modeling in Biology Network.

resource.dataInstitution: European Bioinformatics Institute, Hinxton, Cambridge

datatype.name: ZFIN Phenotype
datatype.definition: ZFIN serves as the zebrafish model organism database. This collection references the phenotypes observed for any given genotype.

resource.dataInfo: ZFIN Phenotype at University of Oregon
resource.dataInstitution: Zebrafish Information Network, University of Oregon, USA

datatype.name: ZFIN Expression
datatype.definition: ZFIN serves as the zebrafish model organism database. This collection references the set of expressed genes for any given genotype.

resource.dataInfo: ZFIN Expression at University of Oregon
resource.dataInstitution: Zebrafish Information Network, University of Oregon, USA

datatype.name: CABRI
datatype.definition: CABRI (Common Access to Biotechnological Resources and Information) is an online service where users can search a number of European Biological Resource Centre catalogues. It lists the availability of a particular organism or genetic resource and defines the set of technical specifications and procedures which should be used to handle it.

resource.dataInfo: CABRI Cell Lines catalogue in Genova (SRS)
resource.dataInstitution: National Cancer Research Institute of Genova, Genova

resource.dataInfo: CABRI Cell Lines catalogue in Brussels (SRS)
resource.dataInstitution: BCCM, Brussels

resource.dataInfo: CABRI Cell Lines catalogue in Paris (SRS)
resource.dataInstitution: nstitut Pasteur, Paris

datatype.name: CYGD
datatype.definition: The MIPS Comprehensive Yeast Genome Database (CYGD) provides information on the molecular structure and functional network of the entirely sequenced the budding yeast, Saccharomyces cerevisiae, as well as on related yeasts which are used for comparative analysis.

resource.dataInstitution: Helmholtz Zentrum München - Deutsches Forschungszentrum für Gesundheit und Umwelt, GmbH, Neuherberg
Institute for Bioinformatics (MIPS)

restriction.statement: Accompanying disclaimer on each page states that data and services are for academic, non-commercial use only.

datatype.name: HUGE
datatype.definition: The Human Unidentified Gene-Encoded (HUGE) protein database contains results from sequence analysis of human novel large (>4 kb) cDNAs identified in the Kazusa cDNA sequencing project.

resource.dataInfo: HUGE at Kazusa DNA Research Institute
resource.dataInstitution: Kazusa DNA Research Institute, Chiba

restriction.statement: The information provided is for research purposes only.

link.desc: Terms and conditions of data use.

datatype.name: BindingDB
datatype.definition: BindingDB is a public, web-accessible database of measured binding affinities, focusing chiefly on the interactions of protein considered to be drug-targets with small, drug-like molecules.

resource.dataInfo: BindingDB At Skaggs School of Pharmacy & Pharmaceutical Sciences
resource.dataInstitution: Skaggs School of Pharmacy & Pharmaceutical Sciences, La Jolla, California

datatype.name: STRING

synonyms.synonym: Search Tool for Retrieval of Interacting Genes/Proteins

datatype.definition: STRING (Search Tool for Retrieval of Interacting Genes/Proteins) is a database of known and predicted protein interactions. The interactions include direct (physical) and indirect (functional) associations; they are derived from four sources:Genomic Context, High-throughput Experiments,(Conserved) Coexpression, Previous Knowledge. STRING quantitatively integrates interaction data from these sources for a large number of organisms, and transfers information between these organisms where applicable.

resource.dataInstitution: European Molecular Biology Laboratory, Heidelberg
European Molecular Biology Laboratory, Heidelberg

restriction.statement: Identifiers are regenerated each time a new STRING version is released, hence the specific information recorded between versions may differ.

datatype.name: STITCH
datatype.definition: STITCH is a resource to explore known and predicted interactions of chemicals and proteins. Chemicals are linked to other chemicals and proteins by evidence derived from experiments, databases and the literature.

resource.dataInstitution: European Molecular Biology Laboratory, Heidelberg

restriction.statement: Identifiers are regenerated each time a new version is released. The best way to reference this information is to use the first segment (14 characters) of an InChi key.

datatype.name: Anatomical Therapeutic Chemical Vetinary
datatype.definition: The ATCvet system for the classification of veterinary medicines is based on the same overall principles as the ATC system for substances used in human medicine. In ATCvet systems, preparations are divided into groups, according to their therapeutic use. First, they are divided into 15 anatomical groups (1st level), classified as QA-QV in the ATCvet system, on the basis of their main therapeutic use.

resource.dataInfo: Anatomical Therapeutic Chemical Vet Index at WHO
resource.dataInstitution: World Health Organisation

datatype.name: Phenol-Explorer
datatype.definition: Phenol-Explorer is an electronic database on polyphenol content in foods. Polyphenols form a wide group of natural antioxidants present in a large number of foods and beverages. They contribute to food characteristics such as taste, colour or shelf-life. They also participate in the prevention of several major chronic diseases such as cardiovascular diseases, diabetes, cancers, neurodegenerative diseases or osteoporosis.

resource.dataInfo: Phenol-Explorer Database on Phenol content of foods
resource.dataInstitution: INRA and University of Alberta

datatype.name: SNOMED CT
datatype.definition: SNOMED CT (Systematized Nomenclature of Medicine -- Clinical Terms), is a systematically organized computer processable collection of medical terminology covering most areas of clinical information such as diseases, findings, procedures, microorganisms, pharmaceuticals, etc.

resource.dataInstitution: Virginia Maryland Regional College of Veterinary Medicine, Virginia

resource.dataInfo: SNOMED-CT at The National Pathology Exchange
resource.dataInstitution: The Health Informatics Service, NHS, West Yorkshire

resource.dataInfo: SNOMED CT at The International Health Terminology Standards Development Organization.
resource.dataInstitution: IHTSDO, Copenhagen

restriction.statement: Access to data may require a license, depending on whether or not it is used in a member country, and for a particular purpose.

datatype.name: MeSH 2012
datatype.definition: MeSH (Medical Subject Headings) is the National Library of Medicine's controlled vocabulary thesaurus. It consists of sets of terms naming descriptors in a hierarchical structure that permits searching at various levels of specificity. This thesaurus is used by NLM for indexing articles from biomedical journals, cataloging of books, documents, etc. This collection references MeSH terms published in 2012.

resource.dataInfo: MeSH at National Library of Medicine
resource.dataInstitution: U.S. National Library of Medicine, National Institute of Health, Maryland
National Center for Biomedical Ontology, Stanford University

restriction.statement: Records accessed through MESH may include content that itself has some copyright restriction when reproduced.

datatype.name: KnapSack
datatype.definition: Knapsack provides information on metabolites and the taxonomic class with which they are associated.

resource.dataInstitution: Nara Institute of Science and Technology

datatype.name: Canadian Drug Product Database
datatype.definition: The Canadian Drug Product Database (DPD) contains product specific information on drugs approved for use in Canada, and includes human pharmaceutical and biological drugs, veterinary drugs and disinfectant products. This information includes 'brand name', 'route of administration' and a Canadian 'Drug Identification Number' (DIN).

resource.dataInfo: Canadian Drug Identification Number at Health Canada
resource.dataInstitution: Health Canada, Ottawa, Ontario

restriction.statement: Need an active session to access information (timeout set at 29 mins).

datatype.name: MassBank
datatype.definition: MassBank is a federated database of reference spectra from different instruments, including high-resolution mass spectra of small metabolites (<3000 Da).

resource.dataInstitution: The MassBank Consortium
The MassBank Consortium

restriction.statement: Downloading, copying, saving, or printing out of materials for purposes other than academic research or education is prohibited.

datatype.name: Golm Metabolome Database
datatype.definition: Golm Metabolome Database (GMD) provides public access to custom mass spectral libraries, metabolite profiling experiments as well as additional information and tools. This collection references metabolite information, relating the biologically active substance to metabolic pathways or signalling phenomena.

resource.dataInfo: Golm Metabolome Database at Max Planck Institute of Molecular Plant Physiology
resource.dataInstitution: Max Planck Institute of Molecular Plant Physiology, Potsdam

restriction.statement: Data in this collection is restricted for non-academic users.

datatype.name: HomoloGene
datatype.definition: HomoloGene is a system for automated detection of homologs among the annotated genes of several completely sequenced eukaryotic genomes.

resource.dataInstitution: National Center for Biotechnology Information (NCBI)

datatype.name: UM-BBD Compound
datatype.definition: The University of Minnesota Biocatalysis/Biodegradation Database (UM-BBD) contains information on microbial biocatalytic reactions and biodegradation pathways for primarily xenobiotic, chemical compounds. The goal of the UM-BBD is to provide information on microbial enzyme-catalyzed reactions that are important for biotechnology. This collection refers to compound information.

resource.dataInfo: Biocatalysis/Biodegradation Database Mirror (Compound) at ETH Zurich
resource.dataInstitution: ETH, Zurich

resource.dataInfo: Biocatalysis/Biodegradation Database (Compound) at University of Minnesota
resource.dataInstitution: Department of Laboratory Medicine and Pathology, University of Minnesota, Minnesota

datatype.name: ABS
datatype.definition: The database of Annotated regulatory Binding Sites (from orthologous promoters), ABS, is a public database of known binding sites identified in promoters of orthologous vertebrate genes that have been manually curated from bibliography.

resource.dataInstitution: Institut Municipal d'Investigació Mèdica, Barcelona

datatype.name: APD
datatype.definition: The antimicrobial peptide database (APD) provides information on anticancer, antiviral, antifungal and antibacterial peptides.

resource.dataInstitution: Eppley Institute for Research in Cancer and Allied Diseases, University of Nebraska Medical Center, Omaha

datatype.name: ChemDB
datatype.definition: ChemDB is a chemical database containing commercially available small molecules, important for use as synthetic building blocks, probes in systems biology and as leads for the discovery of drugs and other useful compounds.

resource.dataInstitution: University of California, Irvine

restriction.statement: Commercial access may require acquisition of a license.

datatype.name: DPV
datatype.definition: Description of Plant Viruses (DPV) provides information about viruses, viroids and satellites of plants, fungi and protozoa. It provides taxonomic information, including brief descriptions of each family and genus, and classified lists of virus sequences. The database also holds detailed information for all sequences of viruses, viroids and satellites of plants, fungi and protozoa that are complete or that contain at least one complete gene.

resource.dataInstitution: Plant-Pathogen Interactions Division, Wheat Pathogenesis Programme, Rothamsted Research Harpenden, Hertfordshire

restriction.statement: Information on this site may be subject to copyright.

datatype.name: IUPHAR receptor

synonyms.synonym: International Union of Basic and Clinical Pharmacology

datatype.definition: The IUPHAR Compendium details the molecular, biophysical and pharmacological properties of identified mammalian sodium, calcium and potassium channels, as well as the related cyclic nucleotide-modulated ion channels and transient receptor potential channels. It includes information on nomenclature systems, and on inter and intra-species molecular structure variation. This collection references individual receptors or subunits.

resource.dataInfo: IUPHAR Receptor at University of Edinburgh
resource.dataInstitution: Centre for Cardiovascular Science, University of Edinburgh, Edinburgh

restriction.statement: Material from this site may be downloaded for personal, non-commercial use.

datatype.name: Aceview Worm
datatype.definition: AceView provides a curated sequence representation of all public mRNA sequences (mRNAs from GenBank or RefSeq, and single pass cDNA sequences from dbEST and Trace). These are aligned on the genome and clustered into a minimal number of alternative transcript variants and grouped into genes. In addition, alternative features such as promoters, and expression in tissues is recorded. This collection references C. elegans genes and expression.

resource.dataInstitution: National Center for Biotechnology Information (NCBI)

datatype.name: ASAP
datatype.definition: ASAP (a systematic annotation package for community analysis of genomes) stores bacterial genome sequence and functional characterization data. It includes multiple genome sequences at various stages of analysis, corresponding experimental data and access to collections of related genome resources.

resource.dataInstitution: Animal Health and Biomedical Sciences, University of Wisconsin, Madison

restriction.statement: May require the acceptance of terms and conditions.

link.desc: Terms and conditions of data use.

datatype.name: ATCC
datatype.definition: The American Type Culture Collection (ATCC) is a private, nonprofit biological resource center whose mission focuses on the acquisition, authentication, production, preservation, development and distribution of standard reference microorganisms, cell lines and other materials for research in the life sciences.

resource.dataInstitution: American Type Culture Collection, Manassas, Virginia

datatype.name: BDGP EST
datatype.definition: The BDGP EST database collects the expressed sequence tags (ESTs) derived from a variety of tissues and developmental stages for Drosophila melanogaster. All BDGP ESTs are available at dbEST (NCBI).

resource.dataInstitution: National Center for Biotechnology Information (NCBI), NIH, Maryland

restriction.statement: Data is a subset of a larger collection.

datatype.name: Dictybase Gene
datatype.definition: The dictyBase database provides data on the model organism Dictyostelium discoideum and related species. It contains the complete genome sequence, ESTs, gene models and functional annotations. This collection references gene information.

resource.dataInstitution: Northwestern University Biomedical Informatics Center and Center for Genetic Medicine, Chicago, Illinois

datatype.name: IMGT LIGM
datatype.definition: IMGT, the international ImMunoGeneTics project, is a collection of high-quality integrated databases specialising in Immunoglobulins, T cell receptors and the Major Histocompatibility Complex (MHC) of all vertebrate species. IMGT/LIGM is a comprehensive database of fully annotated sequences of Immunoglobulins and T cell receptors from human and other vertebrates.

resource.dataInstitution: European Bioinformatics Institute, Hinxton, Cambridge
DKFZ TP3, Heidelberg
CNRS, Montpellier University, Montpellier

restriction.statement: The data are provided as a service to the scientific community to be used only for research and educational purposes.

datatype.name: Worfdb
datatype.definition: WOrfDB (Worm ORFeome DataBase) contains data from the cloning of complete set of predicted protein-encoding Open Reading Frames (ORFs) of Caenorhabditis elegans. This collection describes experimentally defined transcript structures of unverified genes through RACE (Rapid Amplification of cDNA Ends).

resource.dataInstitution: Center for Cancer Systems Biology, Harvard Medical School, Massachusetts

datatype.name: NEXTDB
datatype.definition: NextDb is a database that provides information on the expression pattern map of the 100Mb genome of the nematode Caenorhabditis elegans. This was done through EST analysis and systematic whole mount in situ hybridization. Information available includes 5' and 3' ESTs, and in-situ hybridization images of 11,237 cDNA clones.

resource.dataInstitution: National Institute of Genetics, Shizuoka

restriction.statement: The information does not appear to have been updated in a number of years.

datatype.name: Plant Genome Network
datatype.definition: The Plant Genome Network (PGN) is a resource for the storage, retrieval and annotation of plant ESTs, with a focus on comparative genomics. All data are directly derived from chromatograms with original and intermediate data stored in the database.

resource.dataInstitution: Cornell University, Ithaca, New York

datatype.name: SoyBase
datatype.definition: SoyBase is a repository for curated genetics, genomics and related data resources for soybean.

resource.dataInstitution: USDA-ARS-CICGRU, Iowa State University, Iowa

datatype.name: HAMAP

synonyms.synonym: High-quality Automated and Manual Annotation of microbial Proteomes

datatype.definition: HAMAP is a system that identifies and semi-automatically annotates proteins that are part of well-conserved and orthologous microbial families or subfamilies. These are used to build rules which are used to propagate annotations to member bacterial, archaeal and plastid-encoded protein entries.

resource.dataInfo: HAPMAP at Swiss Institute of Bioinformatics
resource.dataInstitution: Swiss Institute of Bioinformatics, Geneva

datatype.name: Rouge
datatype.definition: The Rouge protein database contains results from sequence analysis of novel large (>4 kb) cDNAs identified in the Kazusa cDNA sequencing project.

resource.dataInfo: Rouge at Kazusa DNA Research Institute
resource.dataInstitution: Kazusa DNA Research Institute, Chiba

restriction.statement: The information provided is for research purposes only.

link.desc: Terms and conditions of data use.

datatype.name: ArrayExpress Platform
datatype.definition: ArrayExpress is a public repository for microarray data, which is aimed at storing MIAME-compliant data in accordance with Microarray Gene Expression Data (MGED) recommendations.This collection references the specific platforms used in the generation of experimental results.

resource.dataInstitution: European Bioinformatics Institute, Hinxton, Cambridge

datatype.name: CGSC Strain
datatype.definition: The CGSC Database of E. coli genetic information includes genotypes and reference information for the strains in the CGSC collection, the names, synonyms, properties, and map position for genes, gene product information, and information on specific mutations and references to primary literature.

resource.dataInstitution: Dept. of Molecular, Cellular, and Developmental Biology, Yale University, Conneticut

datatype.comment: As of September 2013, this collection is no longer maintained. Various archives are available at: ftp://ftp.ncbi.nih.gov/pub/COG/.
datatype.name: COGs
datatype.definition: Clusters of Orthologous Groups of proteins (COGs) were delineated by comparing protein sequences encoded in complete genomes, representing major phylogenetic lineages. Each COG consists of individual proteins or groups of paralogs from at least 3 lineages and thus corresponds to an ancient conserved domain.

resource.dataInstitution: National Center for Biotechnology Information (NCBI), NIH, Maryland

datatype.name: DragonDB DNA
datatype.definition: DragonDB is a genetic and genomic database for Antirrhinum majus (Snapdragon). This collection refers to DNA sequence information.

resource.dataInfo: DragonDB DNA at University of British Columbia
resource.dataInstitution: University of British Columbia, Vancouver

datatype.name: DragonDB Protein
datatype.definition: DragonDB is a genetic and genomic database for Antirrhinum majus (Snapdragon). This collection refers to protein sequence information.

resource.dataInfo: DragonDB Protein at University of British Columbia
resource.dataInstitution: University of British Columbia, Vancouver

datatype.name: DragonDB Locus
datatype.definition: DragonDB is a genetic and genomic database for Antirrhinum majus (Snapdragon). This collection refers to Locus information.

resource.dataInfo: DragonDB Locus at University of British Columbia
resource.dataInstitution: University of British Columbia, Vancouver

datatype.name: DragonDB Allele
datatype.definition: DragonDB is a genetic and genomic database for Antirrhinum majus (Snapdragon). This collection refers to allele information.

resource.dataInfo: DragonDB Allele at University of British Columbia
resource.dataInstitution: University of British Columbia, Vancouver

restriction.statement: Images are subject to copyright.

datatype.name: ISSN
datatype.definition: The International Standard Serial Number (ISSN) is a unique eight-digit number used to identify a print or electronic periodical publication, rather than individual articles or books.

resource.dataInstitution: Library of Congress Online Catalogue, Washington DC

restriction.statement: Session time out prevents direct links.

datatype.name: MEROPS Family
datatype.definition: The MEROPS database is an information resource for peptidases (also termed proteases, proteinases and proteolytic enzymes) and the proteins that inhibit them. These are hierarchically classified and assigned to a Family on the basis of statistically significant similarities in amino acid sequence. Families thought to be homologous are grouped together in a Clan. This collection references peptidase families.

resource.dataInstitution: Wellcome Trust Sanger Institute, Hinxton

datatype.name: MGED Ontology
datatype.definition: The MGED Ontology (MO) provides terms for annotating all aspects of a microarray experiment from the design of the experiment and array layout, through to the preparation of the biological sample and the protocols used to hybridize the RNA and analyze the data.

resource.dataInstitution: National Center for Biomedical Ontology, Stanford University
(Ontology Working Group), European Bioinformatics Institute, Hinxton

datatype.name: NASC code
datatype.definition: The Nottingham Arabidopsis Stock Centre (NASC) provides seed and information resources to the International Arabidopsis Genome Programme and the wider research community.

resource.dataInstitution: The Nottingham Arabidopsis Stock Centre, University of Nottingham

datatype.name: NIAEST
datatype.definition: A catalog of mouse genes expressed in early embryos, embryonic and adult stem cells, including 250000 ESTs, was assembled by the NIA (National Institute on Aging) assembled.This collection represents the name and sequence from individual cDNA clones.

resource.dataInfo: NIAEST at National Institute on Aging
resource.dataInstitution: National Institute on Aging, NIH

datatype.name: Pazar Transcription Factor
datatype.definition: The PAZAR database unites independently created and maintained data collections of transcription factor and regulatory sequence annotation. It provides information on the sequence and target of individual transcription factors.

resource.dataInfo: Pazar Transcription Factor at University of British Columbia
resource.dataInstitution: Centre for Molecular Medicine and Therapeutics, University of British Columbia, Vancouver

datatype.name: Plant Ontology
datatype.definition: The Plant Ontology is a structured vocabulary and database resource that links plant anatomy, morphology and growth and development to plant genomics data.

resource.dataInstitution: Cold Spring Harbor Laboratory, Cold Spring Harbor, New York
National Center for Biomedical Ontology, Stanford

datatype.name: RNA Modification Database
datatype.definition: The RNA modification database provides a comprehensive listing of post-transcriptionally modified nucleosides from RNA. The database consists of all RNA-derived ribonucleosides of known structure, including those from established sequence positions, as well as those detected or characterized from hydrolysates of RNA.

resource.dataInfo: RNA Modification Database at University of Utah
resource.dataInstitution: Department of Medicinal Chemistry and Department of Biochemistry, University of Utah, Salt Lake City, Utah

datatype.name: Science Signaling Pathway-Independent Component
datatype.definition: The Database of Cell Signaling (Science Signaling) contains information on signaling components and their relations. The data are organized into signaling pathways called Connections Maps and are provided by leading authorities in the field. This collection refers to pathway independent component information.

resource.dataInfo: Science Signaling: Pathway-Independent Component at Science Magazine
resource.dataInstitution: Science Mag, Washington DC

restriction.statement: material for personal and noncommercial use

datatype.name: Science Signaling Pathway-Dependent Component
datatype.definition: The Database of Cell Signaling (Science Signaling) contains information on signaling components and their relations. The data are organized into signaling pathways called Connections Maps and are provided by leading authorities in the field. This collection refers to pathway-dependent component information.

resource.dataInfo: Science Signaling: Pathway-dependent Component at Science Magazine
resource.dataInstitution: Science Mag, Washington DC

restriction.statement: material for personal and noncommercial use

datatype.name: Science Signaling Pathway
datatype.definition: The Database of Cell Signaling (Science Signaling) contains information on signaling components and their relations. The data are organized into signaling pathways called Connections Maps and are provided by leading authorities in the field. This collection refers to pathway information.

resource.dataInfo: Science Signaling: Pathway at Science Magazine
resource.dataInstitution: Science Mag, Washington DC

restriction.statement: material for personal and noncommercial use

datatype.name: TreeBASE
datatype.definition: TreeBASE is a relational database designed to manage and explore information on phylogenetic relationships. It includes phylogenetic trees and data matrices, together with information about the relevant publication, taxa, morphological and sequence-based characters, and published analyses. Data in TreeBASE are exposed to the public if they are used in a publication that is in press or published in a peer-reviewed scientific journal, etc.

resource.dataInfo: TreeBASE (hosted at National Evolutionary Synthesis Center)
resource.dataInstitution: Phyloinformatics Research Foundation, Durham, North Carolina

datatype.name: Tetrahymena Genome Database
datatype.definition: The Tetrahymena Genome Database (TGD) Wiki is a database of information about the Tetrahymena thermophila genome sequence. It provides information curated from the literature about each published gene, including a standardized gene name, a link to the genomic locus, gene product annotations utilizing the Gene Ontology, and links to published literature.

resource.dataInstitution: Department of Genetics, School of Medicine, Stanford University, Stanford, California

datatype.name: CMR Gene
datatype.definition: The Comprehensive Microbial Resource (CMR) contains annotation for all complete microbial genomes and allows for a wide variety of data retrievals. This collection refers to the Gene Page which provides information pertaining to a specific gene such as the Locus Name, Gene Symbol, Coordinates, DNA Molecule Name, and Gene Length.

resource.dataInstitution: The Institute for Genomic Research, Rockville, Maryland

datatype.name: TIGRFAMS
datatype.definition: TIGRFAMs is a resource consisting of curated multiple sequence alignments, Hidden Markov Models (HMMs) for protein sequence classification, and associated information designed to support automated annotation of (mostly prokaryotic) proteins.

resource.dataInstitution: The Institute for Genomic Research, Rockville, Maryland

datatype.name: Animal TFDB Family
datatype.definition: The Animal Transcription Factor DataBase (AnimalTFDB) classifies TFs in sequenced animal genomes, as well as collecting the transcription co-factors and chromatin remodeling factors of those genomes. This collections refers to transcription factor families, and the species in which they are found.

resource.dataInfo: Animal TFDB at Hubei Bioinformatics & Molecular Imaging Key Laboratory
resource.dataInstitution: Hubei Bioinformatics and Molecular Imaging Key Laboratory, Wuhan

datatype.name: IUPHAR family
datatype.definition: The IUPHAR Compendium details the molecular, biophysical and pharmacological properties of identified mammalian sodium, calcium and potassium channels, as well as the related cyclic nucleotide-modulated ion channels and the recently described transient receptor potential channels. It includes information on nomenclature systems, and on inter and intra-species molecular structure variation. This collection references families of receptors or subunits.

resource.dataInfo: IUPHAR family at University of Edinburgh
resource.dataInstitution: Centre for Cardiovascular Science, University of Edinburgh, Edinburgh

resource.dataInstitution: Department of Biological Sciences, University of Calgary, Calgary, Alberta

datatype.name: Spectral Database for Organic Compounds
datatype.definition: The Spectral Database for Organic Compounds (SDBS) is an integrated spectral database system for organic compounds. It provides access to 6 different types of spectra for each compound, including Mass spectrum (EI-MS), a Fourier transform infrared spectrum (FT-IR), and NMR spectra.

datatype.name: SPIKE Map
datatype.definition: SPIKE (Signaling Pathways Integrated Knowledge Engine) is a repository that can store, organise and allow retrieval of pathway information in a way that will be useful for the research community. The database currently focuses primarily on pathways describing DNA damage response, cell cycle, programmed cell death and hearing related pathways. Pathways are regularly updated, and additional pathways are gradually added. The complete database and the individual maps are freely exportable in several formats. This collection references pathway maps.

resource.dataInfo: SPIKE database at Tel Aviv University
resource.dataInstitution: School of Computer Sciences and School of Medicine, Tel Aviv University

datatype.name: METLIN

synonyms.synonym: Metabolite and Tandem Mass Spectrometry Database

datatype.definition: The METLIN (Metabolite and Tandem Mass Spectrometry) Database is a repository of metabolite information as well as tandem mass spectrometry data, providing public access to its comprehensive MS and MS/MS metabolite data. An annotated list of known metabolites and their mass, chemical formula, and structure are available, with each metabolite linked to external resources for further reference and inquiry.

resource.dataInfo: METLIN at Scripps Center, Molecular Biology and Center for Mass Spectrometry, La Jolla
resource.dataInstitution: Scripps Research Institute, San Diego

restriction.statement: METLIN services may not be used in commercial applications.

datatype.name: GeneCards
datatype.definition: The GeneCards human gene database stores gene related transcriptomic, genetic, proteomic, functional and disease information. It uses standard nomenclature and approved gene symbols. GeneCards presents a complete summary for each human gene.
